title: Do you wonder sometimes why we are here, or are in awe what is going on all around us? - Quora

response.answer_text: A nice question: I used to wonder why I am here, until I realised I’m here for the same reason every living creature is here — billions of years ago something happened that caused a collection of molecules to replicate itself. From that beginning all life has evolved in a mind-boggling diversity that no one can get their heads around. The time scales are too vast, the sheer number of life forms, most of which have already become extinct is too enormous to contemplate. The billions of mutations that had to occur in order to arrive at whales, spiders, humans trees, sea weeds… leaves me in utter awe at all life, its transience, it’s staying power and the magnificent pointlessness of it all that should inspire awe in every human.
